page.title: 03Farming (Part2)
page.content: {Tir-y-berth and Pengam Region. Glan-Rhymney,Tir-y-berth and Carn Gethin farms were all originally owned and farmed by the same family,with Glan-Rhymney being the home farm.Over the years they have acquired new owners and Carn-Gethin farm has recently been used for residential development.Tir-y-berth farm however is still owned by the same family. Tir-y-berth and Glan-Rhymney are situated close to the village and are both hill farms.The method of farming chosen by these farms is well suited to the environment.Glan-Rhymney specialises in intensive poultry production,the eggs being sold to the local shops.This farm also produces beef cattle Hereford and Freisian.The calves are bought at the cattle market in Newport and reared on nurse cows.When they are 18 to 20 months old
